DataElement.preferredName: Intratumoral or Peritumoral Lymphocytic Disease Response Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The disease status or response to treatment of intratumoral or peritumoral lymphocytes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Intratumoral Or Peritumoral Lymphocytic Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._Within a tumor._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Located in tissues surrounding a tumor._Of or pertaining to lymphocytes._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredName: Intratumoral Or Peritumoral Lymphocytic Disease Response
Property.preferredDefinition: Within a tumor.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Located in tissues surrounding a tumor.:Of or pertaining to lymphocytes.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: Within a tumor.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Located in tissues surrounding a tumor.
Of or pertaining to lymphocytes.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-10; Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Tumor Response Result Terminology Outcome
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the tumor response result codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM)._The result of an action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Open to question.

Concepts.definition: Open to question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No new lesions(s) and a decrease in tumor size, or a reduction in central necrosis or attenuation in one or more enhancing lesions, based on pre-defined thresholds.

Concepts.definition: No new lesions(s) and a decrease in tumor size, or a reduction in central necrosis or attenuation in one or more enhancing lesions, based on pre-defined thresholds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A conversion from one disease diagnosis to another, which may be considered a progression to a worsening state.

Concepts.definition: A conversion from one disease diagnosis to another, which may be considered a progression to a worsening state.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A partial decrease in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.

Concepts.definition: A partial decrease in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No change in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.

Concepts.definition: No change in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minor decrease in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.

Concepts.definition: A minor decrease in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimal decrease in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.

Concepts.definition: A minimal decrease in abnormal karyotype, based on pre-defined thresholds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, including the absence of a detectable disease-related genetic abnormality, as determined by techniques such as karyotyping or FISH, in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, including the absence of a detectable disease-related genetic abnormality, as determined by techniques such as karyotyping or FISH, in response to treatment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Complete Response with Incomplete Bone Marrow Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Complete Response with Incomplete Bone Marrow Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

Concepts.longName: Complete Response with Incomplete Bone Marrow Recovery
Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.22 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002191. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on physical exam, such as palpation.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on physical exam, such as palpation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of disappearance of metabolic tumor activity in target and non-target lesions, marked by a decrease in tumor standardized uptake value to the level of surrounding normal tissue.

Concepts.definition: A finding of disappearance of metabolic tumor activity in target and non-target lesions, marked by a decrease in tumor standardized uptake value to the level of surrounding normal tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of cancer in response to treatment, including platelet and white blood cell counts returning to normal levels, a non-palpable spleen, and no immature white blood cells present in the blood unless it is a regenerating marrow following treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of cancer in response to treatment, including platelet and white blood cell counts returning to normal levels, a non-palpable spleen, and no immature white blood cells present in the blood unless it is a regenerating marrow following treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer based on physical exam, such as palpation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The amount of cancer antigen 125 is reduced by 75% from protocol-defined baseline value(s).

Concepts.definition: The amount of cancer antigen 125 is reduced by 75% from protocol-defined baseline value(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The amount of cancer antigen 125 is reduced by 50% from protocol-defined baseline value(s).

Concepts.definition: The amount of cancer antigen 125 is reduced by 50% from protocol-defined baseline value(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The absence of change in the overall attenuation of the metastasis and in the peripheral rim, suggesting a lack of response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The absence of change in the overall attenuation of the metastasis and in the peripheral rim, suggesting a lack of response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Mixed attenuation and some homogeneity of the metastases with a partially resolved peripheral rim.

Concepts.definition: Mixed attenuation and some homogeneity of the metastases with a partially resolved peripheral rim.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hypo-attenuation of the metastases which may appear pseudocystic, perfectly homogeneous, and devoid of a recognizable peripheral rim.

Concepts.definition: Hypo-attenuation of the metastases which may appear pseudocystic, perfectly homogeneous, and devoid of a recognizable peripheral rim.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No apparent change or worsening in tumor staging classification.

Concepts.definition: No apparent change or worsening in lesion staging classification.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

Concepts.definition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated Long Name and Definition to match current NCIt. mc 4/27/2020

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Presence of non-quantifiable residual disease based on laboratory techniques.

Concepts.definition: Presence of non-quantifiable residual disease based on laboratory techniques.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Following a previous assessment of progressive disease unconfirmed (PDu) of non-target lesion(s), the subsequent required assessment does not confirm progressive disease.

Concepts.definition: Following a previous assessment of progressive disease unconfirmed (PDu) of non-target lesion(s), the subsequent required assessment does not confirm progressive disease.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) without unequivocal progression following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.longName: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease
Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) without unequivocal progression following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diagnostic tests fail to detect presence of disease.

Concepts.definition: Diagnostic tests fail to detect presence of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unable to be evaluated.

Concepts.definition: Unable to be evaluated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Presence of residual disease based on pre-defined thresholds and return of quantifiable MRD positivity after a period of MRD negativity.

Concepts.definition: Presence of residual disease based on pre-defined thresholds and return of quantifiable MRD positivity after a period of MRD negativity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is an improvement in the measures of disease burden, meeting a predetermined threshold, but not meeting partial response criteria.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is an improvement in the measures of disease burden, meeting a predetermined threshold, but not meeting partial response criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of leukemia, accompanied by bone marrow recovery, in response to treatment. Hematologic recovery is not required. Leukemia free state can be a hypocellular marrow.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of leukemia, accompanied by bone marrow recovery, in response to treatment. Hematologic recovery is not required. Leukemia free state can be a hypocellular marrow.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of cancer, accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

Concepts.longName: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery
Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of cancer, accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by morphological analysis.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by morphological analysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in signs of cancer, supported by molecular analysis.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in signs of cancer, supported by molecular analysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by molecular analysis.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by molecular analysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minor decrease in signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination and based on pre-defined thresholds.

Concepts.definition: A minor decrease in signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination and based on pre-defined thresholds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the number of bone marrow plasma cells to protocol-defined level(s).

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the number of bone marrow plasma cells to protocol-defined level(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A major decrease in signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination and based on pre-defined thresholds.

Concepts.definition: A major decrease in signs of cancer, supported by pathological examination and based on pre-defined thresholds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

Concepts.definition: Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity based on predetermined boundaries following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity based on predetermined boundaries following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease based on a predetermined threshold in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease based on a predetermined threshold in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response that is neither favorable nor unfavorable.

Concepts.definition: A response that is neither favorable nor unfavorable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by the absence of phenotypically aberrant plasma cells (clonal) in bone marrow. (Rajkumar SV, Harousseau J, Durie B et al, Consensus recommendations for the uniform reporting of clinical trials: report of the International Myeloma Workshop Consensus Panel 1. Blood. 2011; 117(18):4691-4695)

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by the absence of phenotypically aberrant plasma cells (clonal) in bone marrow. (Rajkumar SV, Harousseau J, Durie B et al, Consensus recommendations for the uniform reporting of clinical trials: report of the International Myeloma Workshop Consensus Panel 1. Blood. 2011; 117(18):4691-4695)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.

Concepts.definition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An improvement of platelet count as a response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: An improvement of platelet count as a response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An improvement of neutrophil count as a response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: An improvement of neutrophil count as a response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An improvement in erythrocyte count as a response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: An improvement in erythrocyte count as a response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial response with additional serum and urine M-protein reduction, but not meeting complete response.

Concepts.definition: Partial response with additional serum and urine M-protein reduction, but not meeting complete response.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An increase in tumor size, based on a pre-defined threshold, or the development of new lesion(s), marked central fill-in of a lesion, or new enhancement of a previously homogeneously hypoattenuating nonenhancing mass.

Concepts.definition: An increase in tumor size, based on a pre-defined threshold, or the development of new lesion(s), marked central fill-in of a lesion, or new enhancement of a previously homogeneously hypoattenuating nonenhancing mass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Leaving no doubt; not open to question.

Concepts.definition: Leaving no doubt; not open to question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lack of expected or desired effect related to a therapy.

Concepts.definition: The lack of expected or desired effect related to a therapy.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.22 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002191. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The absence of change or mild changes of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions based on a pre-defined threshold.

Concepts.definition: The absence of change or mild changes of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions based on a pre-defined threshold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer is neither decreasing nor increasing, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.

Concepts.definition: The size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer is neither decreasing nor increasing, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The confirmed disappearance of all signs of cancer, and absence of molecular or cytogenetic marker of disease, in response to treatment with additional biochemical, immunological and histopathological analyses to verify the CR.

Concepts.definition: The confirmed disappearance of all signs of cancer, and absence of molecular or cytogenetic marker of disease, in response to treatment with additional biochemical, immunological and histopathological analyses to verify the CR.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept annotation and changed case of Long Name. mc 4/11/17

PermissibleValues.value: RELAPSED DISEASE FROM CR OR PR
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Relapsed Disease From Complete or Partial Response

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Relapsed Disease From Complete or Partial Response
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of complete remission or partial remission.

Concepts.longName: Relapsed Disease From Complete or Partial Response
Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of complete remission or partial remission.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of complete remission.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of complete remission.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.1.20 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001943. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Presence of quantifiable residual disease based on laboratory techniques.

Concepts.definition: Presence of quantifiable residual disease based on laboratory techniques.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The amount of prostate specific antigen is increased, based on pre-defined thresholds.

Concepts.definition: The amount of prostate specific antigen is increased, based on pre-defined thresholds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer, accompanied by an increase in blood lymphocyte count above a predetermined threshold.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer, accompanied by an increase in blood lymphocyte count above a predetermined threshold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions, based on a pre-defined threshold.

Concepts.definition: A decrease of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions, based on a pre-defined threshold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An increase of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions, based on pre-defined thresholds, or the development of new lesions.

Concepts.definition: An increase of metabolic tumor activity in all relevant lesions, based on pre-defined thresholds, or the development of new lesions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.

Concepts.definition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Progression or Relapse After Hematologic Improvement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Progression or Relapse After Hematologic Improvement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Disease progression or the return of a disease after a period of remission, occurring after a hematologic improvement.

Concepts.longName: Progression or Relapse After Hematologic Improvement
Concepts.definition: Disease progression or the return of a disease after a period of remission, occurring after a hematologic improvement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: There is an increase in the size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.

Concepts.definition: There is an increase in the size and extent of tissue involvement by cancer, based on CT scan and criteria-defined assessments.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Disease progression occurring after a partial response.

Concepts.definition: Disease progression occurring after a partial response.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:
2023.5.17 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002435. ak 
2023.3.15 Per LS at COG Protocol defined progressive disease (should have been added as a VM Alt Name for PV 3284666). ak

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No Steroid Use Beyond Physiologic Replacement Dose

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No Steroid Use Beyond Physiologic Replacement Dose
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that the subject's steroid dose is the same as their physiologic replacement dose.

Concepts.longName: No Steroid Use Beyond Physiologic Replacement Dose
Concepts.definition: An indication that the subject's steroid dose is the same as their physiologic replacement dose.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A marked decrease in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor shrinkage, but that may be due to anti-angiogenic therapy or an increase in steroid dosage.

Concepts.definition: A marked decrease in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor shrinkage, but that may be due to anti-angiogenic therapy or an increase in steroid dosage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that something improved.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that something improved.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A radiologic finding observed during magnetic resonance imaging of brain glioblastoma, following concurrent radiotherapy and temozolomide treatment or vaccine therapy. It refers to the false positive finding of progression and enhancement of the lesion. It is considered a treatment effect due to tumor cell necrosis and subsequent edema formation and increased vascular permeability.

Concepts.definition: A radiologic finding observed during magnetic resonance imaging of brain glioblastoma, following concurrent radiotherapy and temozolomide treatment or vaccine therapy. It refers to the false positive finding of progression and enhancement of the lesion. It is considered a treatment effect due to tumor cell necrosis and subsequent edema formation and increased vascular permeability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In an declined condition.

Concepts.definition: In an declined condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stable; subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

Concepts.definition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Made less in size or amount or degree.

Concepts.definition: Made less in size or amount or degree.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Changed concept definition to match current NCIt. mc 4/13/17

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

Concepts.definition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Remission with persistent lymphoid nodules in the bone marrow

Concepts.definition: Remission with persistent lymphoid nodules in the bone marrow.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concepts for UPMC project per request by U.Reddy. mc 2/25/15

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission, as determined by clinical signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission, as determined by clinical signs and symptoms.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease of greater than or equal to 30% in TMTB relative to baseline, non-target lesions are irNN, and no unequivocal progression of new non-measurable lesions

Concepts.definition: A decrease of 30% or more in TMTB relative to baseline, non-target lesions are irNN, and no unequivocal progression of new non-measurable lesions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A complete disappearance of  all measurable and non-measurable lesions. Lymph nodes must decrease to less than 10 mm in short axis. Confirmation of response is not mandatory.

Concepts.definition: A complete disappearance of all measurable and non-measurable lesions. Lymph nodes must decrease to < 10 mm in short axis. Confirmation of response is not mandatory.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A failure to meet criteria for irCR or irPR in the absence of irPD.

Concepts.definition: A failure to meet criteria for irCR or irPR in the absence of irPD.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum 20% increase and minimum 5 mm absolute increase in total measured tumor burden compared to nadir, or irPD for non-target or new non-measurable lesions. Confirmation of progression is recommended minimum 4 weeks after the first irPD assessment.

Concepts.definition: A minimum 20% increase and minimum 5 mm absolute increase in total measured tumor burden compared to nadir, or irPD for non-target or new non-measurable lesions. Confirmation of progression is recommended minimum 4 weeks after the first irPD assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Tumor Response Result Terminology Outcome
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the tumor response result codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).:The result of an action.

Concepts.longName: CDISC SDTM Tumor Response Result Terminology
Concepts.definition: Terminology associated with the tumor response result codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).
The result of an action.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2020-10-8 ak Versioned for removal of CT term. Updated to CT Package 43 release.
ValueDomain.administrativeNotes: 2023.7.17 Updated to CT Package 54 release. ak 2023.6.5 Released per WZ review. ak 2023.2.6 Created new version to reflect CT Pkg 52 updates. Ak

ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the lymphocytic disease response?

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for CTEP CDE Harmonization Response CRF. mc 3.12.2021
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.6 Updated to VD 1.2 to reflect CT Pkg 52 updates. ak 10/21/22 added 1 alt name, 2 AQTs, 1 classification for the CTEP CDISC Harmonization project;
